utterance.content: Interesting. This has nothing to do with you, your ex-wife, or my pain. I was heading to the Downstate Correctional Facility in Fishkill.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: One of your hookers arrange a conjugal visit?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's where Foreman's brother is being held.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: This is going to mean months of sleepless nights, wondering if I could've done something differently. Maybe it's not that I'm sick of House. It's that I'm sick of being scared out of my mind to go to work every day. Sorry. Did that just… Was that you?

utterance.speaker: Molly
utterance.content: Are you really in there? I knew you were in there.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: I was scared.

utterance.speaker: Molly
utterance.content: Thank God.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: I am scared. Molly, I love you so much.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Have you had any bloody diarrhea in the last two weeks?

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Rotavirus out.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Any recent joint pain?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Epstein-Barr's out.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Have you traveled out of the country lately?

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: What about inside the country?

utterance.speaker: Molly
utterance.content: He was in St. Louis.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Good. Could be Missouri malaria. Let's start treatment.

utterance.speaker: Molly
utterance.content: He was… he was there. The machine must not be working.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hmmm. Either that or he lied to you about it. People do that sometimes. For example, I just lied to him about Missouri malaria.

utterance.speaker: Molly
utterance.content: Did you go to St. Louis?

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: I should've told you. Why didn't I just tell you? Down.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: When you weren't in St. Louis for two days, I assume you were getting some strange for two days.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: So does she. You have to tell her I wasn't.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Amazing. A man who only has two blips at his disposal can still lie.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: I'm not lying.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If you were getting some really strange strange, you could've contracted neurosyphilis. Infection went to your brain, froze you right up. Good news is it's treatable. You'll be up and moving in time to sign the divorce papers.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: Why would I tell you the truth about being in St. Louis, and then not tell you the truth about this?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: He just admitted he wasn't in St. Louis in front of his wife, and you think he's lying when she's not even in here?

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: I'm liking this one more and more. Don't fire him.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Were you out of the state?

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: I never left.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Were you within 20 miles of your house?

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Were you within five miles?

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Within two miles?

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Did you stay at a hotel?

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You had to sleep somewhere. Your car?

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: A friend's house?

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: Yes. Yes.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That narrows it down, depending on how popular you are. Tell the wife to stop crying, get in here. He says that when he was supposed to be in St. Louis, he was staying at a friend's house.

utterance.speaker: Molly
utterance.content: Really.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Let's assume that you believe him for the moment. Name your friends within two miles.

utterance.speaker: Molly
utterance.content: Martin and Kim's?

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Guess someone who doesn't have a wife.

utterance.speaker: Molly
utterance.content: Dave?

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Got an address?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: If this is where he got sick, someone else here should have symptoms.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Not if Lee was the only one coming down to the basement.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Furnace is rusty, but no gas leaks.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Resumes and cover letters here… some are weeks old. He's been spending time here for a while.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: Business wasn't going good. I didn't want you and the kids to worry. I was trying to protect you. Molly… I wish you could hear me. I wish I could make all of this better.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Looks like he temped a few times. As a janitor. Factory out on Route 10.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Factory foreman says they make rechargeable batteries. Mostly for cell phones.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Big step down from running your own business, to sweeping up.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: Doing what I had to do.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Metal filings. Judging by the color, I'd say cadmium.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Which he'd aerosolize with the broom, then right into his lungs. Heavy metal poisoning explains everything.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: The chelation will scrub the heavy metals out of your blood. If we are right about the cause, we should see some movement in about a day or so.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: Can't put this thing on turbo? I'm getting a little anxious in here.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Somebody will be here at all times to uh, irrigate your eyes, keep you company. Hopefully, it'll help make the time go quicker.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: My eyes still feel really dry.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Thank you… for thinking "up." For helping me find you in there. Man, when you moved that cursor…

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Bought my first girlfriend a necklace. It was silver. It cost 180 bucks… had to save for six months. She hated it.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: Really, seriously? Did you tell this story to someone who could walk away?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Never bought another girlfriend jewelry again. Until Dr. Hadley.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: You're dating her? You might want to start all your stories with that.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Same thing. She didn't even wear it.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: The diamond thing? She was wearing it the other day.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: If she doesn't like it, she doesn't like it. Apparently, I suck at picking out jewelry, but least have the guts to tell me.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: Okay, getting boring again. How long till we know if this treatment is working?

utterance.speaker: Molly
utterance.content: You lied to me.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: I wasn't having an affair.

utterance.speaker: Molly
utterance.content: So we needed money. Who cares?

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: Last time business was slow, you got migraines every day.

utterance.speaker: Molly
utterance.content: Why would you do that to me?

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: I'm sorry, I was… I was stupid. I was… don't go! Don't! Damn it, somebody… put "I'm sorry" on this stupid computer. My eye is killing me.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I want to keep my job.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Great. All you gotta do is come up with a good idea.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: How about we hook the guy's brain to a computer, so he can communicate?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That's a great idea. For the guy who invented the computer that can read minds. Your idea was to use his idea.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You didn't come up with it. No one else came up with it. If I didn't re-establish communication, we never would have found —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What's interesting is why you're here now. Not when I gave you the ultimatum. Was it something the patient said?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I realized that what we do here… terrifies me. And… overcoming that is the only way I can matter.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Kutner found the battery factory. Kutner came up with the cadmium. Maybe you don't matter.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I'm going to close your eyes so you can get some sleep. Hopefully, when you wake up, we'll see some improvement.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: Hope that includes my eye feeling better.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Hand me the flourescein stain.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: What's that mean?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Epithelium looks torn. These drops sting.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: Ow!

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I'm going to close your left eye to keep it protected. I'm going to blink your eye a few times to distribute the dye. Ulcerative keratitis.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Means it's not cadmium poisoning.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: Which means you don't know what's wrong. Again.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: When's the last time you changed that dressing? Judging by the smell of it, I'd say never.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He's locked-in, his kidneys blew a fuse, and now his eye is oozing pus.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I assume you went over all of that with your team. I also assume they didn't have any brilliant ideas, or you wouldn't still be muttering to yourself. This is going to hurt.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Ow! The way he's losing his myelin makes an infection most likely. Could be varicella —

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Road debris has come to the surface. I'm going to have to scrub it out.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: But the initial acyclovir would've treated that. Which pushes me towards an autoimmune disease. Like Behcet's.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Here… this is going to hurt even more. Take two now, two later.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oops. Ho! Of course, if the varicella was resistant, it wouldn't matter what they did up in Middletown.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Do an LP.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You've been in the ER too long. When the patient had head trauma, white blood cells only indicate that he had head trauma.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Or you could use the LP for something useful. If you find polys, it's varicella. Lymphs, Behcet's.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why did I fire you again?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You didn't. I quit.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You weren't visiting Foreman's brother, either.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Busy. Kutner's doing an LP, so I have to focus.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I had prison security check visitor logs, phone records. You've never had any contact with anyone at Fishkill. So, I ask again… What were you doing up in Middletown?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You know what's more interesting than what I was doing? The reason you are so obsessed with what I was doing.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Stop deflecting, House.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Says the deflector. The reason I was up there is the reason you're scared I was up there. I was checking out your dirty, little secret. How long have you been sleeping with her?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: How… how did you know?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Your only secrets are the girls you find embarrassing. And the only embarrassing girl you've met recently is the one at your brother's cuckoo facility.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: We've only been out a few times.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She's a caregiver. Like all of your other failed exes. And someone who takes care of your brother. Who was the last person who took care of your brother?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You think this is Oedipal?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Actually, I was thinking masturbatory, but I guess your mom took care of him first. So, the safe course is to gouge your eyes out.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: LP stands for lumbar puncture. We use this needle to collect fluid from your spine.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: That's a really big needle.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You're going to feel some extreme pressure in your back.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: I already feel pressure in my front… my chest hurts.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: …your chest, sort of in the fetal position.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: Something's wrong.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: …the best angle into your spine.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: No, my chest! Something's wrong. I think I'm hav…

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Pull the needle out.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: Oh, God! I’m flatlining.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Call a code.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: There is no God. You don't know what's wrong with me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It doesn't seem that way.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: So am I dead?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not yet. But you're about to be.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Charging… clear. Again… clear.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He's back.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: No. No. Let me go. He can't fix me. I've been here for three days, everything hurts.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The arrest means the demyelination hit the area in his brainstem that controls heart rhythm. We need answers fast, ‘cause this is going to happen again.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: We need to get him started on steroids.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: It's okay, just… just…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not without the results of the LP.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: …stop fighting. She's got to go on with her life. The kids don't need this. I can't do nothing for them… I can't… scratch this foot… Wow, that really, really itches.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: So we should try —

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: So we put in a temporary pacer, it’s not gonna —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Shut up, shut up. He's trying to talk. Is something bothering you?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: If there's still tightness in your chest, it's expected.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Is it your eye?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Why is he saying "no" three times? You only asked one question.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Maybe he's not saying "no," maybe he's saying "down." Are you saying that the pain is lower? How low, your leg? Your foot?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Left foot? Check his… let me see now… yeah, his right foot.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No bruises, no rashes, no cuts.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Then there should be no pain. Is it a tingling sensation? Is it itching?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Itchy foot means liver failure.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: The liver's fine. His enzymes have been normal since we admitted him.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I didn't say "failing," I said "failure." Just like you. Liver's like a cruise ship taking on water. As it starts to sink, it sends out an S.O.S. Only instead of radio waves, it uses enzymes. The more enzymes in the blood, the worse the liver is. And once the ship has sunk, there's no more S.O.S. You think the liver's fine, but it's already at the bottom of the sea.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: So dying liver released toxins, damaged the nerves, led to locked-in syndrome.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Now we just need to know what's causing the liver failure.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Liver, plus eye, plus kidney… most likely sclerosing cholangitis.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, God, if only Taub had said that, it would've been a happy ending. Do a biopsy to confirm.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'm going to numb up the area where we'll go in for the punch biopsy.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Where's the new bracelet?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: She was wearing the bracelet?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You didn't notice that I was wearing it?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Because you weren't.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: He noticed, and you didn't?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: If you don't like it, it's fine. It's not a big deal.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I like it, that's the point. I'd rather have it at home in the jewelry box than getting peed on at work.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: You got the patient's urine on that arm?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: When I was putting in the catheter. Why?

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: You've got a rash.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The bracelet's real.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: I figured. So what if the rash isn't just a rash? What if it's an infection? If there were rats in that basement, then the liver failure could be caused by leptospirosis. It transfers through urine. Rat pee to him, his pee to you. The infection would need an entry point. Look for any recent scratches, cuts.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Look. Next to his fingernail.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: The infection destroyed your liver, which released toxins that caused the locked-in syndrome. You were dying of a paper cut.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: I hope you're right this time.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Let’s start him on high dose penicillin G.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: We found rats in your buddy Dave's basement. Tested positive for leptospirosis. That means we're on the right treatment. So… try moving a finger. Your brain needs to get used to doing its job again. Try harder. I'm sure you've lost hope. I know we've told you several times that we knew what this was, but this time we're right. Concentrate. Move one finger for me. Welcome back.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: I did it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Rat pee. Very nice idea. Who came up with it?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I did.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Good. You okay with him claiming the credit?

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: It was his idea. He saw the rash —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If he did, he'd have hung a "mission accomplished" banner in my outer office.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Don't toy with him. If you're going to fire him —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The fact that he stole your idea means that he cares enough to lie. That's all I needed to know. Rat pee. That's a very nice idea.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: House. You left this in my office.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, I didn't. So either I have a hole in my pocket —

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Oh, that's right I remember now, I stole it. Because if you had gone up there to check out my girlfriend, you wouldn't have come back here and lied to me about it. You would've thrown her right in my face.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You underestimate the entertainment value of your obsessions.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: And then there were all those calls you weren't taking in front of me. So I dialed the number of the calls you weren't taking. You're seeing a psychiatrist.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You had no right to invade my privacy.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Is… is that…?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah. It's irony.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: Hey. God sent you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Suddenly, you're not so fascinating.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You're spying on your team.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Prioritize, Wilson. Is that what you really want to torture me about right now?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I don't want to torture you at all. I think this is a great thing. Not something you have to drive an hour out of town to shroud in mystery.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah. Whining on someone's couch. That's an excellent use of my time. Maybe I'll discover that my childhood wasn't perfect.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: So your attitude about therapy clearly hasn't changed. And yet you went. Which leads me to believe that maybe something else has changed. Maybe you think you can change. Credit Cuddy with that.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not much credit to take, because I'm not going back.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Oh, House, please… I assume you went because you're tired of screwing up every chance you get at happiness.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Delete contact.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Do not let the fact that I found out about it —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Don't beat yourself up. I'm not going back because it doesn't work.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You'll end up alone.
